The tech-review Web site Engadget calls it a rickshaw without all the charm.

PUMA, by the way, stands for Personal Urban Mobility and Accessibility.
Designed for urban travel, the PUMA is more or less a sit-down Segway for two.
It balances on its two wheels, operates on electric motors and can travel up to 35 miles an hour.
GM says it could begin producing PUMAs in 2012.
It won't comment on price, saying only that it might cost about one-third of what it takes to own and operate a traditional vehicle.
